column5: Bought a Humminbird Piranhamax Portable fishfinder 160 (08-19-10) and pretty happy with it. Before this weeks trip to Big Hawk lake I thought I'd charge the battery (Last used in June) and the charger started clicking in between colors. I used the unit anyways and it worked for awhile but the screen flashed randomly and finally shut off on the second day.  When charged before it would last all week easily...  Anyways, the battery looks brand new with no leaks etc. but is probably the culprit.  Not sure on the warranty, (will look it up) but does anyone have other ideas?  Also, let me guess, if I'm on the hook for another battery it will probably be crazy $$$? A friend said it looks like a security camera battery...  Checking BassPro now (where I bought it).  BTW, skunked and probably got a cold on Big Hawk. Stormy Friday night, ok Saturday, and cold rain Sunday with no fish to show. Gonna have to read more posts on trout success stories for sure!
Could be the charger, I had one die on me as well with my portable ice kit.  The battery kits are like $35 from Radioworld.  Come with a new battery + charger.
You can go to a security business and get em for 20-30 bucks...  Also I think can tire has em
Thanks for the replies guys. I am in the Hamilton area, may have a look around CT. Its $45 +Tax at RadioWorld - one hour away (PLUS Toronto traffic).

These guys will have them   Great Northern Battery Systems & ACME Battery Co. Ltd. Email: [emailÂ protected] 475 Parkdale Avenue N. Hamilton, Ontario, Canada L8H 5Y4 Phone: 905-549-4454 Toll Free: 1-877-549-4454
$45 + Tax (Battery & Charger) in Hamilton, will pick up this week. Thanks guys!
